trailingComments.value: Dynamically create publicly accessible event functions.

leadingComments.value: Dynamically create publicly accessible event functions.

trailingComments.value: Expose utility merge function.

leadingComments.value: Expose utility merge function.

trailingComments.value:
*
   * Processes our queue of event handlers for a given eventName.
   * If a handler returns 'undefined' then we give the next handler
   * the original arguments so that every handler gets to touch the
   * data.
   * @param {string} eventName Event key where the handlers live.
   * @param {*} args Arguments.
   * @return {Promise} Promise that resolves to the ending value of the
   *   promise chain.
We allow a plugin to return undefined or null to implicitly
allow us to use the original value that was passed into the
plugin handler.

leadingComments.value: We allow a plugin to return undefined or null to implicitly
allow us to use the original value that was passed into the
plugin handler.

trailingComments.value: If our original value was an array of 1 and is now not an
array because a plugin just returned the value stick it back
into an array to keep its type consistent.

leadingComments.value: If our original value was an array of 1 and is now not an
array because a plugin just returned the value stick it back
into an array to keep its type consistent.

right.value: return all arguments given to it.
right.rawValue: return all arguments given to it.
right.raw: ' return all arguments given to it.'

right.value: return all arguments in given order.
right.rawValue: return all arguments in given order.
right.raw: ' return all arguments in given order.'

trailingComments.value: If we have only one value then unpack it.

leadingComments.value: If we have only one value then unpack it.
